conclusion: Determine heat exchange Q in cyclic process for ideal gas.
Temperature at state A is 27°C (300 K).
Identify processes: A to B is isobaric, B to C is isochoric, C to D is isobaric, D to A is isochoric.
Calculate work done A to B: W_AB = 1 x 10^5 J.
Calculate work done B to C: W_BC = 0 (constant volume).
Calculate work done C to D: W_CD = -0.75 x 10^5 J.
Calculate work done D to A: W_DA = 0 (constant volume).
Calculate total work done in cycle: W_total = 0.25 x 10^5 J.
Change in internal energy for ideal gas in cyclic process is zero.
Apply first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Since ΔU = 0, Q = W_total = 0.25 x 10^5 J.
Final answer: Heat exchange Q is 0.25 x 10^5 J.
